commit.message: Replace coloris with vanilla-colorful (#30201) Found [a better color picker](https://github.com/web-padawan/vanilla-colorful) that [does not rely](https://github.com/mdbassit/Coloris/issues/139) on `querySelectorAll` or a global shared instance, and is also around a third of the size of the previous one. The popover is handled by tippy.js for which I introduced a new "bare" theme and it uses a new sibling-based mechanism which should prove useful later to create tippy popovers via HTML only.

verification.payload: tree 7214f233f4caefa3b727ec116b7471c383faf0f4 parent 654cfd1dfbd3f3f1d94addee50b6fe2b018a49c3 author silverwind 1712135706 +0200 committer GitHub 1712135706 +0000 Replace coloris with vanilla-colorful (#30201) Found [a better color picker](https://github.com/web-padawan/vanilla-colorful) that [does not rely](https://github.com/mdbassit/Coloris/issues/139) on `querySelectorAll` or a global shared instance, and is also around a third of the size of the previous one. The popover is handled by tippy.js for which I introduced a new "bare" theme and it uses a new sibling-based mechanism which should prove useful later to create tippy popovers via HTML only.

commit.message:
Add -u git to docs when using docker exec with root installation (#29314)

This fixes a minor issue in the documentation for SSH Container
Passthrough for non-rootless installs. The non-rootless Dockerfile and
docker-compose do not set `USER`/`user` instructions so `docker exec`
will run as root by default. While running as root, gitea commands will
refuse to execute, breaking these approaches. For containers built with
the rootless instructions, `docker exec` will run as git by default so
this is not necessary in that case.

This issue was already discussed in #19065, but it does not appear this
part of the issue was ever added to the documentation.

verification.payload:
tree 6fcac351b4c44d6b92d9e6a173ea4e1979779b61
parent 6f4e2e79ffd1a244e9c266db19840a5bfda09119
author scribblemaniac <scribblemaniac@users.noreply.github.com> 1712108833 -0600
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1712108833 -0400

Add -u git to docs when using docker exec with root installation (#29314)

This fixes a minor issue in the documentation for SSH Container
Passthrough for non-rootless installs. The non-rootless Dockerfile and
docker-compose do not set `USER`/`user` instructions so `docker exec`
will run as root by default. While running as root, gitea commands will
refuse to execute, breaking these approaches. For containers built with
the rootless instructions, `docker exec` will run as git by default so
this is not necessary in that case.

This issue was already discussed in #19065, but it does not appear this
part of the issue was ever added to the documentation.

commit.message:
Fixes #27605: inline math blocks can't be preceeded/followed by alphanumerical characters (#30175)

- Inline math blocks couldn't be preceeded or succeeded by
alphanumerical characters due to changes introduced in PR #21171.
Removed the condition that caused this (precedingCharacter condition)
and added a new exit condition of the for-loop that checks if a specific
'$' was escaped using '\' so that the math expression can be rendered as
intended.
- Additionally this PR fixes another bug where math blocks of the type
'$xyz$abc$' where the dollar sign was not escaped by the user, generated
an error (shown in the screenshots below)
- Altered the tests to accomodate for the changes

Former behaviour (from try.gitea.io):

![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/114936010/8f0cbb21-321d-451c-b871-c67a8e1e9235)

Fixed behaviour (from my local build):

![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/114936010/5c22687c-6f11-4407-b5e7-c14b838bc20d)

(Edit) Source code for the README.md file:
```
$x$ -$x$ $x$-

a$xa$ $xa$a 1$xb$ $xb$1

$a a$b b$

a$b $a a$b b$

$a a\$b b$
```

---------

Signed-off-by: João Tiago <joao.leal.tintas@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>
Co-authored-by: Giteabot <teabot@gitea.io>

verification.payload:
tree 9e667a0ba89366b757a5213a9baa96e523b8a984
parent ca5c895efb91d2c2f17a83460e1753101c6f6bb1
author João Tiago <114936010+jmlt2002@users.noreply.github.com> 1712081740 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1712081740 +0000

commit.message:
Fix missing 0 prefix of GPG key id (#30245)

Fixes #30235

If the key id "front" byte has a single digit, `%X` is missing the 0
prefix.
` 38D1A3EADDBEA9C` instead of
`038D1A3EADDBEA9C`
When using the `IssuerFingerprint` slice `%X` is enough but I changed it
to `%016X` too to be consistent.

verification.payload:
tree 9e7cd3a58877415edc8941196925e87cc835bbb9
parent 944c76e78423405a33450eb3d07cd2b772f4a81c
author KN4CK3R <admin@oldschoolhack.me> 1712073057 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1712073057 +0200

Fix missing 0 prefix of GPG key id (#30245)

Fixes #30235

If the key id "front" byte has a single digit, `%X` is missing the 0
prefix.
` 38D1A3EADDBEA9C` instead of
`038D1A3EADDBEA9C`
When using the `IssuerFingerprint` slice `%X` is enough but I changed it
to `%016X` too to be consistent.

commit.message:
Refactor DeleteInactiveUsers, fix bug and add tests (#30206)

1. check `IsActive` before calling `IsLastAdminUser`.
2. Fix some comments and error messages.
3. Don't `return err` if "removing file" fails in `DeleteUser`.
4. Remove incorrect `DeleteInactiveEmailAddresses`. Active users could
also have inactive emails, and inactive emails do not support
"olderThan"
5. Add tests

verification.payload:
tree 468c30aaf56164379a9495783b6d2b6fd153d093
parent 3607f827fb432378dbe7d90bdedbff4fd4565e13
author wxiaoguang <wxiaoguang@gmail.com> 1711937195 +0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711937195 +0000

Refactor DeleteInactiveUsers, fix bug and add tests (#30206)

1. check `IsActive` before calling `IsLastAdminUser`.
2. Fix some comments and error messages.
3. Don't `return err` if "removing file" fails in `DeleteUser`.
4. Remove incorrect `DeleteInactiveEmailAddresses`. Active users could
also have inactive emails, and inactive emails do not support
"olderThan"
5. Add tests

commit.message:
Remove jQuery class from the `repo-issue.js` file (#30192)

Switched from jQuery class functions to plain JavaScript `classList`.

Tested the following functionalities and they work as before:
- delete issue comment
- cancel code comment
- update (merge or rebase) pull request
- re-request review
- reply to code comment
- show/hide outdated comments
- add code comment
- edit issue title

---------

Signed-off-by: Yarden Shoham <git@yardenshoham.com>
Co-authored-by: silverwind <me@silverwind.io>

verification.payload:
tree 77e7f3d94a70e6ff075c5b04685b3addf49bfaff

author Yarden Shoham <git@yardenshoham.com> 1711886481 +0300
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711886481 +0000

commit.message:
Fix markdown color code detection (#30208)

When reviewing PRs, some color names might be mentioned, the
`transformCodeSpan` (which calls `css.ColorHandler`) considered it as a
valid color, but actually it shouldn't be rendered as a color codespan.

verification.payload:
tree 67936cfb90c2a1acc3d0c491d01b9a53e15244c5
parent 6d34ce25b16cdfd6e2e364aebe546e3c2fbb76c6
author wxiaoguang <wxiaoguang@gmail.com> 1711883854 +0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1711883854 +0800

Fix markdown color code detection (#30208)

When reviewing PRs, some color names might be mentioned, the
`transformCodeSpan` (which calls `css.ColorHandler`) considered it as a
valid color, but actually it shouldn't be rendered as a color codespan.
